Articles.Content:
I\'ve got a little problem. Last time when I wanted to land on Moon I saw something strange and I have no idea what it can be. Maybe someone of you know what is that?

http://img72.imageshack.us/img72/363/wtflyg.jpg

I\'ll try to get there again but for now it\'s the best screenshot what I have

PS: Sorry for my english, I\'m Polish
That is the Mun Arch. Congrats on finding it.
This is only one building on moon?

This is only one building on moon?

It\'s one of two.
OK, thanks I\'ll try to find another one Bye
It\'s not the only secret on the mun, if you know what I mean... Best of luck!
It\'s actually one of three, but you need special sensors to find the third as it\'s underground
Can you give me coordinates beacouse I have no idea where the last one was. Were I have to look to find another one? I think one is near to crater with defile but I\'m not sure

Well, the easy one to find is pretty much on the equator, easily seen if you orbit 10,000 or lower (some people have actually orbited THROUGH them). The second is about 10Âº inclination north, and about 40Âº closer to the center meridian. The third can\'t be seen at all and you need the Muon Detector to even know it\'s there.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10170.0

The Muon Detector is of course not used solely for finding the arches and is most often used for finding the other easter eggs on the MÃ¼n, Kearth, and Minmus.

I haven\'t spent a lot of time looking for the ones on Kearth, though that\'s next. I\'ve just about covered everything I can on the MÃ¼n.

1st: 2.424 North / 81.444 East

2nd: 12.471 North / 39.261 East

3rd: 12.454 South / 140.826 West (750 meters underground from my best calculations)

You should really try to find them yourself before resorting to just being told though, it\'s much more fun
Thank you very much So there are some easter eggs on minmus? I\'ll try to find them but now I want to land near Arch. And Muon Detector is mod?
Yes, the Muon Detector is a mod. I put a link to it in my previous post.

Well, the easy one to find is pretty much on the equator, easily seen if you orbit 10,000 or lower (some people have actually orbited THROUGH them). The second is about 10Âº inclination north, and about 40Âº closer to the center meridian. The third can\'t be seen at all and you need the Muon Detector to even know it\'s there.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10170.0

The Muon Detector is of course not used solely for finding the arches and is most often used for finding the other easter eggs on the MÃ¼n, Kearth, and Minmus.

I haven\'t spent a lot of time looking for the ones on Kearth, though that\'s next. I\'ve just about covered everything I can on the MÃ¼n.

1st: 2.424 North / 81.444 East

2nd: 12.471 North / 39.261 East

3rd: 12.454 South / 140.826 West (750 meters underground from my best calculations)

You should really try to find them yourself before resorting to just being told though, it\'s much more fun

Niftyâ€¦ thanks for the link to the Muon detector. Also, it\'s Kerbin, not Kearth.
Oh, I thought the people were Kerbins. But I do believe you\'re right. Now that I think about it, in the map it does say Kerbin.
Underground arch? Is there some kind of cave or hole?

Not that I\'ve been able to find, but if you use the Muon Explorer there is SOMETHING that sets it off on a flat plain. It could be a monolith I suppose, but in a previous version someone was able to get it to glitch so they could look underground and they say it\'s an arch.

I did it! I saw Arch on 60.000m but it was harder to get there xD

http://img715.imageshack.us/img715/7114/gewa.png

Thanks for everyone xD
